subject: Re: [PATCH v4 00/25] fuse/io-uring: add kernel-managed buffer rings and zero-copy

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Joanne Koong (author), raised no specific technical concerns or objections in her review of the patch series.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb raised a question about the possibility of an issue in io_uring_fixed_index_get() and io_uring_fixed_index_put(), but also gave a Reviewed-by tag, indicating overall approval.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Bernd Schubert reviewed patches in the series, providing feedback on several patches and requesting changes. He suggested adding a sanity check in fuse_copy_do() to ensure cs->len is > 0 when cs->is_kaddr is true. Additionally, he pointed out an unused flag that could be used instead of introducing new flags.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Reviewer Bernd Schubert raised concerns about initialization of cs->len in fuse: support buffer copying for kernel addresses and pointed out a confusing condition in io_uring/kbuf: add recycling for kernel managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Christoph Hellwig
reviews.summary: Christoph Hellwig suggested splitting the patch series into smaller ones for easier review and made several technical comments on specific patches.

reviews.author: Askar Safin
reviews.summary: The reviewer questioned whether the kernel-managed buffer rings (kbufs) solve the same problem as splice, and referenced a quote from Linus Torvalds in 2006 to support their claim.
